text: {"answer": "C", "reasoning": "The excerpt ends with 'Article 14 of the Convention taken in conjunction with Article 8', which is a section heading introducing a new complaint. Choice C naturally follows such a heading by addressing the complaint under Article 8 (and implicitly Article 14) and explaining that, given a prior finding of a violation under another provision (Article 3 of Protocol No. 1), the Court does not need to examine this complaint separately. This is a standard ECHR approach where the Court declines to examine additional complaints after finding a violation on related grounds. The other options either deal with admissibility determinations or merits examinations that don't align with the transitional heading provided."}
